03750B810F494D1F8A3D8A2047F51E24.description: Research duties and rights of workers and employees as they relate to The Saskatchewan Employment Act and The Occupational Health and Safety Regulations.

6ACD3EDF5C574F5BB88FCAB0926437EC.description: Outline an entry level business plan that may include start-up costs, location, customer base, advertising and an exit plan.

F94D7B32E1B74164994160FB7E3580EF.description: Research the importance of sustainable business practices such as providing quality customer service, following environmental guidelines and employing qualified and certified personnel.

8BFE15349D5B4293963DA538CE667A71.description: Research the requirements (e.g., registering business name, collecting and remitting taxes, licensing, zoning) for establishing a small business in one’s community.

AF70951F49FB4988A1DC19DD8CBB64C8.description: Investigate the advantages and disadvantages of different business ownership models, including sole proprietorship, partnerships and private corporations.

F3F5FEB9D62643AC82C3F18A52AD19B6.description: Explore related business opportunities in other sectors such as production design, exhibition design, visual merchandising, set decorating, retail store interior design coordination and kitchen design.

90674B27BE02464891FB2538FE236971.description: Research the types of business opportunities available in interior design and decorating.

64E6411D63AF429886A944D1E7E7E1F9.description: Investigate business opportunities in interior design and decorating.

F97B3F7E7863475E8DC34E777D2D8D13.description: Interior Design and Decorating Business Opportunities (Optional)

F86C0647287D482AAEC7825461B4CDC7.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

3ABAE770C8294113B641CAD88BC7B53C.description: Prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer, expressing appreciation.

E6905CF94CFC4B26AE1F3BFA91EF6546.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., résumé, portfolio) following the work placement.

A98DC4D9424848C293A8D0E44D722BEC.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

72AFC7B246FD40B8BCA9FCA38FD8499A.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: • hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

04A3E16BAF4B4332A1DB78DB60493491.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

246912067AA54674BD174A898B078685.description: Document knowledge and awareness of labour standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

D663623F6E7C4F8F94915A36825646C6.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

38D2F3CBDF4842B88DE2ACCB2A127724.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

C4298811BA104F26BF0A88A7722D7465.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

CC7592DFA2EC4A7181A82E87E1618CEF.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

3E7A26BEC7DB42E0A1AA746EDBC652B3.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

4D8CDC3AA1EB4357906F59C096CE22E7.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

08C8B34FDDFE4E68BE455A96BE1C9041.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?,  Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

A3882ED8031A4929AD49CD9F87250127.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

3C6B5650BBA54A39BD3186D11EE06756.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution

7641851145B54536B440E089E0ED10D6.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

F9EEF78A97DF462FA109E922D5758B0E.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations

FEB6011AA68245CB89E9B2A1A50B8101.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

1CBCCA4809934829A4C8EA9C27A0E2FA.description: Describe and reflect on the three basic rights that all workers have under Part III – Occupational Health and Safety in The Saskatchewan Employment Act, 2019: the right to know – the hazards at work and how to control them; the right to participate – in finding and controlling workplace hazards; and, the right to refuse – work that you believe is unusually dangerous

ED494D26E7BC4A4C84C23DB59EE5073C.description: Identify entrepreneurial opportunities available in interior design or decorating.

8671BDBFD1F044B791682F51B82217DD.description: Develop a plan to attain a job of one’s choice in the interior design or decorating occupations

14CC344896D94A74A7806E187EEEB9EE.description: Communicate research findings related to interior design and decorating occupations through a display, brochure, video, presentation software, website or an oral presentation.

976204B505D44410A6915136D70211E4.description: Research duties and rights of workers and employees as they relate to The Saskatchewan Employment Act and The Occupational Health and Safety Regulations.

2113DB125D524A8E95555479A6780D31.description: Investigate the role of provincial and national regulatory and trade organizations related to interior design and interior decorating

EED6810B34134B1FA43A623485FFD6B2.description: Reflect upon personal suitability or non-suitability for a specific interior design or decorating related occupation considering criteria such as: initial and continuing educational requirements; duties and skills required for this occupation; the work environment, including typical hours and shifts worked and typical locations; current wages received in Saskatchewan and how these compare to the rest of Canada; physical, mental and emotional stresses related to this occupation; workplace hazards and safety considerations; other occupations with which they interact; certification requirements in Canada and Saskatchewan; and, future trends impacting the occupations.

704700DB0E7B4F9C82972E86F3F39FD7.description: Examine the roles, responsibilities, educational qualifications and personal and professional qualities common to people involved in interior design and decorating careers

146C420C0BFE43348E77C59B72D83856.description: Research which interior design and decorating occupations are facing shortages and which are oversubscribed locally, regionally or provincially.

E5D3A97A341D4BCE96D2EAF18DB94822.description: Investigate careers in the interior design profession (e.g., interior and spatial designer, production designer, exhibition designer, visual merchandiser) and in the interior decorating profession (e.g., set decorator, retail store interior design coordinator/manager, kitchen designer, design coordinator, entrepreneur, residential stager).

958D1FA7F7C54C69897005B0DF6A7C8E.description: Create a list of personal interests, skills and traits that could lead to a career in the interior design and decorating professions.

885300895DAE45408B390859FEA37C75.description: Explore interior design and decorating related occupations.

5632817CD2E8462BACC154ECD470A17F.description: Careers in Interior Design and Interior Decorating (Core)

B6CE3C36383B4045ABD7689C490E0D11.description: Reflect on personal successes and challenges experienced.

0E13AB9D841A46AE95140DB3DE624A1F.description: Develop a decorating project using the following guidelines: generate different project ideas; plan and manage the project, including assessment criteria; plan and create drawings with appropriate symbols; create style boards, for a defined space, selecting a style and using the elements and principles of design; determine a procedural sequence; prepare a materials list and cost estimate; create a timeline; identify potential end users for a defined space; identify potential needs, wants and preferences of the end users; prepare materials and set up in the proper sequence; complete each part as specified; interpret and follow directions; adhere to timelines; work cooperatively; follow all safety requirements; and, present the completed project.

3F6FB185372C430BA35E5CD3A62E1F2D.description: Apply interior decorating knowledge to plan and decorate a defined space.

3BFC9FE3062F4F2D9C213D43AE9C00AE.description: Reflect on personal successes and challenges experienced.

21F24B1103FA469981FA3EA29D647D4F.description: Develop a design project using the following guidelines: generate different project ideas; plan and manage the project, including assessment criteria; plan and create drawings with appropriate symbols; create floorplans, perspective drawings or scale models for a defined space using universal design principles and the elements and principles of design; determine a procedural sequence; prepare a materials list and cost estimate; create a timeline; identify potential end users for a defined space; identify potential needs and wants of the end users; prepare materials and set up in the proper sequence; complete each part as specified; interpret and follow directions; adhere to timelines; • work cooperatively; follow all safety requirements; and, present the completed project.

F0D5092AEC274B7BA9FD77BCD056FF37.description: knowledge to plan and design a defined space.

37B7509F10CE4516A771BA2FB65DE1B1.description: Create a visual representation of decorative, functional and educational accessories that can be used in a variety of residential and commercial spaces.

2DD86D87C35741B59D113E008DC8412E.description: Identify current trends related to accessories (e.g., blankets, books, throws) in commercial and residential spaces.

E81A5BB148264327BDE52B5682441228.description: Research the types, functions and traditional history of area rugs.

6FDCBECCF926497494534BB4F0F7DEED.description: Explore accessories (e.g., water features, plants) that create a healthier environment.

147143655C15432B830691FE6F8E20FE.description: Explore various types of lighting sources such as ambient (e.g., chandeliers, recessed ceiling lights, track lighting), task (e.g., floor lamp, pendant lights, vanity lights) and accent (e.g., picture lights, can lights).

ECC2BDAF20594958A2E2B57D91A467A8.description: Identify factors to consider when using wall art in interior residential or commercial spaces.

D39BFABE16354492B159C58F428B2F36.description: Examine using educational accessories (e.g., alphabet letters and geometric shapes) in public spaces, such as pediatric hospital units.

DFC6691D5B4B457BBE34F5F2BE89EF06.description: Explain how decorative (e.g., wall art, collectables) and functional (e.g., mirrors, clocks) accessories can contribute to the design scheme.

A66872999F93495EB4A064887493E26A.description: Examine the role of decorative and functional accessories in decorating residential and commercial spaces.

0073E3996ACD4645BE40A33331C2353F.description: Discuss differences between residential and commercial appliances, fixtures and equipment.

EC1A29848B934D238F9ED57867CE1CCF.description: Examine Canadian legislation (e.g., Energy Efficiency Act, Energy Efficiency Regulations) and programs (e.g., ENERGY STAR®) that support energy efficiency in household appliances.

7700CDC2EFB246F890512BC239A944B2.description: Research the energy consumption of typical residential appliances such as washing machines, clothes dryers, dishwashers, freezers, refrigerators, televisions and computers

CBF4DA2D53D049B6A084A194B0003191.description: Discuss the costs and benefits of different types (e.g., limited, extended, manufacturer’s) of warranties available when purchasing appliances.

A9F386A5059843F9BEC19D462BF7013C.description: Research and compare consumer and manufacturing reports when selecting residential or commercial appliances and electronic equipment.

D6385C1F588A41A9AE072FCD69E377F5.description: Identify factors to consider (e.g., client needs, capacity, style, features, quality, energy consumption) when selecting household or commercial appliances, fixtures and equipment.

8B9B557E16A842818174A34AA7F8F028.description: Analyze appliance, fixture and equipment options for residential and commercial spaces.

8F8EB701BF6D4361AA85EB19A9D2CFF2.description: Develop a checklist or rubric to use when evaluating sustainability aspects of furniture for clients.

42FEB936ADD447529BCAB9A04E8D17EA.description: Analyze the impact of various floor plans and furniture configurations on traffic flow and focal points

80DC0DABB28A442C8B0D84B3808832D5.description: Examine how ergonomics informs furniture planning decisions to optimize human well-being.

EED0E10A46164C5291B98A918104C35B.description: Compare the characteristics of various furniture styles (e.g., early American, Queen Anne or Shaker) and influences (e.g., Greek, Renaissance or Baroque).

E271D5701CAC42B783312E54D92AFA3D.description: Explore the history, construction, design and function of various types of furniture from select time periods (e.g., ancient civilizations, Middle Ages, Renaissance, Neo-classical, Modern).

8AB7A16515A046F1B574CBA4B7EC7B3D.description: Contrast processes for purchasing residential and commercial furniture.

6605DC695E7440A48CC3C66972F38B7D.description: Research options to acquire new, used or custom-made furniture locally, regionally, nationally and globally.

D03A7D5CD5064DEEA6663889FFC1C1C9.description: Examine factors to consider (e.g., location, durability, source of materials, style, cost, colour, comfort) when selecting residential or commercial furniture.

8441CB29DAA74A57AEE1C9C45AB0E029.description: Differentiate between the standards of construction, quality and features of residential furniture and those of commercial furniture.

DB19C999AB8B47EAA117E947B8AE6764.description: Identify common types of furniture (e.g., chairs, sofas, tables, desks, beds, workstations, indoor/outdoor) to consider for residential and/or commercial settings.

8D89BC0B3E4841BAB0FF30B0DF88BA7B.description: Examine how decorators select and place furniture to help shape and define space.

C3E983880E5647429F2BCBDF8571D60B.description: Analyze furniture options for decorating residential and commercial spaces.

D98654C8EC8C4696A58FF10C191916C0.description: Explain how to use technical sheets, safety data sheets and pictograms from the Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS) to obtain information about product safety.

D83863297F3D48EF8D6F2C0F07434035.description: Identify potential health, safety and welfare considerations (e.g., allergic reactions, sickness, fire hazard), when decorating residential or commercial spaces that can result from the inappropriate selection of interior materials, particularly flammable and combustible materials and those that emit toxins and toxic fumes.

802E5A738D6C43418A5AFA8CDBF7D229.description: Research various levels of legislation and programs (e.g., LEED® Indoor Environmental Quality credits, LEED® Canada-CI for commercial interiors) that encourage the responsible use of materials and finishes.

E9BBA737F3ED40B78610B2444979D9CF.description: Estimate the quantity, cost of materials or finishes and labour to decorate a particular area in a commercial or residential space.

8D047E639B60424BA828FBC35F936F1C.description: Investigate the characteristics, including energy efficiency, of common window treatments (e.g., blinds, shutters, curtains, drapes, shades).

A7502CE7017741D0AB367A7EC67280AF.description: Research the characteristics and potential environmental impacts of common soft (e.g., carpet, resilient flooring) and hard (e.g., wood, tile, concrete) flooring materials

443E980F004E4E77B1FD6807960E65AD.description: Compare the advantages and disadvantages of common types of wall treatments (e.g., paint, wallcoverings, cladding).

BB076AF372074D769D2D64376CA729BD.description: Identify common styles of wall, ceiling and floor treatments for decorating residential and commercial interiors.

FAE535BC0A224598A464A06BF71676A4.description: Analyze factors (e.g., client tastes, life cycle, flammability, infection control, decorative theme, energy conservation, maintenance, budget) to consider when decorating residential or commercial spaces

EF104B86630A479AB9E6C3BB1F3D9263.description: Provide examples of how seasonal trends are implemented in residential and commercial spaces.

F8F540554B334C55A30B61B0E2329B94.description: Examine a variety of design trends (e.g., shabby chic, farmhouse, industrial) represented in decorating and design.

F40860ECA41848AE821CDB98E1382E50.description: Explore the characteristics of interior materials, treatments and finishes.

8B90D57534444708BDB4FFB6B707ACBA.description: Identify major issues to consider when designing educational facilities.

C20B9C5D28A840629EA479555B80D24A.description: Compare how interior design differs among types of retail spaces such as malls, boutique shops and big-box stores

787B4166DE404CCB891BEBD7C44216C0.description: Examine the role of corporate style and branding in office, hospitality and retail interior design projects.

73F336C0E7D24140A767D487CA19D115.description: Discuss the complexity of designing interiors for healthcare facilities, referencing issues such as life safety systems, patient focus, emerging technologies, waiting rooms, nursing stations and family and visitor areas.

7D61AF9BA2E6445FA01FBA36B1BD4CA8.description: Identify historical and contemporary trends in commercial interior design

167DAFF26EA84C02AE62C8DD20D45994.description: Explain ways in which commercial interior design differs from residential interior design.

731D0A11AF544D7DA0C41C01C4B06DB9.description: Provide examples of common types (e.g., office, hospitality, healthcare, retail and education) of commercial interior design projects.

DD024626B2364D7186CA3CBFD555136D.description: Investigate weather sustainable materials used to furnish outdoor spaces.

D154A0AD01354AB29A46E4E6B2A39D77.description: Explore three-season and four-season room designs.

4ACE42EB27C0418C87E01122E144DF47.description: Investigate how designers can apply principles of sustainability to outdoor spaces.

39D10BA0ACA94DE2AFD5E8D80E78B25A.description: Explore how to use a balance of soft scape and hard scape elements in landscaping residential or commercial properties.

410CB2FD18034C51AB18708D8024E19F.description: Explore the use of natural elements in exterior spaces in both commercial and residential design.

7A731834F4214268B4D8683EBEED729F.description: Explore how interior designers might collaborate with landscape designers or landscape architects to design outdoor spaces.

8BFB15F907AE41219DCA5B9D0116AC7B.description: Analyze how design principles apply to outdoor spaces.

7F0469201BB84B9B86AE37865182231F.description: Explore the potential of 3-D printing to meet future housing demands.

E0DE403B5AC64BE5BDD06177796DC156.description: Examine how current and historical environmental conditions (e.g., areas prone to floods, areas prone to fires) can influence future housing design.

2EA761547E54465FA25D61D60461466E.description: Predict how changes in social conditions may affect future housing design (e.g., socially inclusive housing).

E7E474161D234C9192302B459DFC048C.description: Create, using drawing skills, computer-aided design programs or modelmaking, an innovative energy efficient space considering factors such as passive or active energy sources, windows, appliances and sustainable construction materials.

DD0C498ED4AD45E09D838D9FA9CFD180.description: Research available financial incentives to retrofit residential spaces to improve energy efficiency.

A82AC4B01C6745CF8E4DA17E1B748685.description: Describe the operation and benefits of active and passive energy management systems.

E90F7840335A4B3787D5D856ADBC26B2.description: Research the impacts of energy-saving techniques including: site selection and placement of building; design of building; wall assembly; energy efficient roof; glazing systems; and, heating and cooling systems.

4EA450C56E5C4E8D8F3DA9B00B83B0D0.description: Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of building materials such as earth, recycled wood or plastic composite lumber, straw bales, insulating concrete forms and recycled steel.

FC36A61976B84946BE86194AA3E997B4.description: Research the characteristics and environmental impact of a variety of materials (e.g., wood, glass, steel, concrete) used in design.

4FEAEEFAEF9D4961A153B3D1A53A413F.description: Provide examples of how wood, glass, steel and concrete are used in residential and commercial buildings.

92864C323664410E854CAFFB16C0A2AD.description: Discuss factors (e.g., strength, durability, performance, aesthetic appearance, maintenance) that influence the choice of building materials.

28666796BC8A4D2F95F1E1F0C26B88CA.description: Research the history of building materials from various eras.

E46885AF162142D2A3E3C74EEBD281BF.description: Examine the characteristics of residential and commercial building materials.

BCAF4315181B4C86B1611C871A01D163.description: Create a visual representation (e.g., drawing, model, digital rendering) of building components that can be used in a variety of residential and commercial spaces.

019C4C60A3A04AA7A0307B5F6ED50A7E.description: Evaluate the following to determine suitability for a defined space: window types such as bay or bow, single and double hung, horizontal slide, casement, stationary, awning and hopper; door types such as flush, panel, French, Dutch, barn, folding, sliding and stacking; wall options such as storage walls, movable walls, pony walls, structural walls, party walls and partition walls; ceiling types such as cove, open beam, dropped, cathedral, vault, tray and conventional flat; flooring options such as vinyl, cork, ceramic tile, hardwood, engineered wood and bamboo; and, roof options such as asphalt shingles, wood shingles and shakes, clay tiles and metal roofing.

C63BF7F000AF4BEBAC9BC2436948F5DB.description: Investigate the types of questions interior designers may have with respect to each major building component (e.g., Is the wall load bearing? Can a stairwell be moved or reconfigured? Is there plumbing or wiring in the wall?).

09D13D96CC6F472B814B30328C2FD566.description: Identify current Saskatchewan residential and commercial building codes and advisories for concepts such as: venting for stoves; egress for bedrooms; railing for stairs; and, types of materials used.

D04829CA55674B9EA6EFC7A497F59D29.description: Discuss the responsibilities an interior designer has regarding awareness of government regulations such as building and fire codes.

2200210CECC5405CB9F20C85A4672EE1.description: Discuss the importance of standardized regulations (e.g., zoning bylaws, building codes) in providing requirements that ensure the safety, health and well-being of occupants, builders and the community.

74091E7B089A425AA8516F75C71C4F45.description: Examine how housing has evolved to meet human needs using available materials.

7D62623A52B741B09DEC8A1043A78286.description: Examine the characteristics and evolution of housing styles.

527BB518159041C88ACC3A5346AEEC2A.description: Discuss own and peer’s floorplan to provide feedback on the strengths and areas of improvement.

295B24BE52C14DEF906D5A33AF5424BC.description: Develop assessment criteria in consultation with peers and instructor to assess floor plan of a specific type of space.

9BFD3AA047BF485AB6724BA66EF308B9.description: Design a floor plan for a specific house type.

55253FC2EF5742DD94D4A5AA6835ACF3.description: Examine how the layout of different types of housing influence interior design and decorating options

89E90AA08C784C61B98B923B7FE5B7EE.description: Identify the advantages and disadvantages of different configurations (e.g., apartments, row houses, mobile homes, single family detached dwellings, duplexes, homes on wheels, tiny homes, co-housing) of living units.

B0373D68B56D4B6EAD26F368855146A1.description: Research how zoning bylaws affect choices of housing types.

0B166E3D1A8E43D1919C7D1CF59C99B8.description: Investigate different types of houses found locally, regionally, nationally and globally

AF68709B72A14C339337812179CB1B6B.description: Compare the characteristics of common detached house types (e.g., bungalow, bi-level, two-storey, split level and 1 ½ storey).

271CBB28D5F149C793A123A77C433271.description: Examine the characteristics of various types of housing.

80A08CFBBCD0483683003B9FB9DEAD0A.description: Discuss how renovating existing spaces can contribute to environmental sustainability.

86E14B6E495640B480F637DD4E51EC6C.description: Identify how interior designers and interior decorators can incorporate principles of sustainable design, such as designing for: low environmental impact; longevity and flexibility; waste reduction; and, healthy environments.

84764F91428D41A883D11C568410B044.description: Investigate the role of the WELL Building StandardTM in promoting features for buildings, interior spaces and communities that support human health and wellness.

9397979A7E3347DC852526DD1AEC8986.description: Research concepts relating to sustainable design including: sustainability; eco-friendly; reducing; reusing; recycling; repurposing; revaluing/upcycling; and, life cycle cost/maintaining.

CDE42C90DC664B7882F52DDC4FF40332.description: Identify the primary goals of sustainable interior design.

0BB33D2E13D3454D9E2B6DC842FD50E4.description: Examine the principles of sustainable design for interior design and decorating.

9D955DC511FE4BB6AF1432E600630DA2.description: Construct concept boards to present potential space plan ideas to clients

5B15F0441424421E9337C301C8AB05DC.description: Evaluate the needs of potential users and design floorplans for a specific space that addresses: private zones; public zones; work zones; traffic flow; and, storage needs.

C2B36E0E5F5A4902BC5C62AE5802B6E2.description: Create bubble diagrams to analyze the zones and the relationships between zones for a client’s space

A4C7E592A881497E8A5B9195D4AD500B.description: Analyze traffic patterns in various floorplans, considering factors such as: door and window placement; swing of doors; room entry and exit points; seating needs; furniture placement; kitchen work triangle; and, emergency routes.

E4E313D6F5914B94A732C72E498A1916.description: Provide examples of how public and private zones are connected (e.g., stairs, halls, archways) in residential and/or commercial spaces.

033D096888AB419AB9A92F4209A3AFFC.description: Explain the need to consider safety when planning and designing spaces, considering things such as stairs, rails and balconies.

6C147BBEAD17492D9F934DE9A0FFB50F.description: Provide examples of how public, private and work zones are arranged in relation to each other in residential and/or commercial spaces

8569E89277BC47D695ABB9FD46235066.description: Describe the characteristics of typical public (e.g., entry, living room, dining room, meeting room), private (e.g., bedrooms, bathrooms) and work (e.g., kitchen, laundry, office) zones in residential and/or commercial spaces.

F0E7934CD6364043853EDC35C9D2A239.description: Explain the goals of space planning for interior design projects

A8368027EBA042CABCCE1BB59D2ED241.description: Examine the process of space planning for interior design projects.

2687087640E546C58AFDB2724B43FE0A.description: Apply one or more design approaches to plan a residential or commercial space that fosters inclusivity and access for all (e.g., gender identity and expression, ability, age, culture).

68329CF4BB3C43A684CE1D4713222497.description: Discuss the role of legislation (e.g., National Building Code of Canada, Accessible Canada Act, The Uniform Building and Accessibility Standards Act) and standards (e.g., CSA B651-12 Accessible Design for the Built Environment) regarding accessibility

A04D3C935F324F85B3229E4D1F087800.description: Compare the drawbacks and benefits of adaptable housing models such as flexible housing, multigenerational housing, accessory and secondary suites.

C6A91F6F9330426EBDDD3487B478B00D.description: Investigate options and benefits for retrofitting a defined residential or commercial space to meet various accessibility needs.

191395E27675449399F601984F80AD91.description: Provide examples of how principles of universal design ensure current and future accessibility for residents in different types of spaces.

9F63C703072247BF8EA7D800109DA2D2.description: Research the impact accessible design, adaptable design and universal design have on physical and psychological health and well-being.

7DFCDF4ACB4847E0A0C38C1C4EC8766F.description: Discuss the need for adaptable housing to meet occupants’ changing accessibility needs through different stages of life

87588381E14A4492AACF8A3F6F7FEB55.description: Investigate how individuals’ accessibility needs may change over time.

3127430149F14154ABFE4075F06E7D27.description: Explore potential challenges related to accessibility when designing and decorating residential and commercial spaces.

86F1D4715F0546CDAC2C5AED7D809EE1.description: Discuss the concept of accessibility (e.g., visual impairment, hearing impairment, limited mobility, cognitive and intellectual conditions) designers and decorators should consider when creating safe, aesthetically pleasing spaces and meeting clients’ needs.

1B18BDCE4E474426AF18996E72CCB54B.description: Investigate socially inclusive designs that support clients living with various physical, cognitive and intellectual conditions.

42D80AE8DBBF4BB684315565FBB60F3C.description: Differentiate among accessible design (e.g., wide door openings, roll under countertops), adaptable design (e.g., upgradable, expandable, dividable) and universal design (e.g., open floor plan, lever handles) approaches.

067B3BF11AF14514A140561E62140ECB.description: Examine how interior designers and decorators incorporate inclusive design approaches to meet client needs.

11EA9AC9B1C94A46825B6F2A075FC86B.description: Communicate intended concepts for design or decorating projects using written, verbal and visual presentation techniques.

37EFB114F0CB4592972EAD579597C836.description: Identify components commonly included on various (e.g., concept, material, style) presentation boards

7D3078BE4144435797CCA8642D01119F.description: Explore the role of concept boards, material boards and style boards in presenting different aspects of interior design and decorating projects to clients.

002B50AED5D746B18358043D6557E4EE.description: Create presentation models for client review

AC6365177CEC478680CBC0176379A664.description: Read, interpret and construct technical drawings.

BCCA8B89EFC64B26867B37E5BFB060D9.description: Explore how to use digital rendering tools to construct technical drawings.

55C721477E2045B7A843C9DD8C423B2C.description: Investigate the role of sketching to develop initial interior design and decorating ideas.

F0F88F07BA4F43209E2608F83BD37336.description: Identify common abbreviations, alphabets of lines and symbols commonly used in blueprints

2E4A13FEE13345559481CF8013427511.description: Explain the purpose of architectural symbols and conventions commonly used in floorplans.

F4743994FA034E64BB448D7A42036940.description: Investigate common architectural drawing conventions such as scale, line weights, dimension lines, section views, elevations and plan views.

7CDC7989104042BABEFA96760826A50A.description: Explore the range of drawing equipment (e.g., pen and paper, digital) interior designers and interior decorators use to create and communicate their ideas and plans.

76B2FDEE6DC547D49920118E582E863F.description: Discuss the importance of using various visual formats to present design ideas to clients.

4184800DE0DB4298B5754FCD703BCD11.description: Explore tools and techniques used to present interior design and decorating ideas.

B154A0D80E8E4AF4B4EDB28D10336018.description: Explore considerations (e.g., aging, health changes, sensory) for accessibility when remaining in the same home.

606ED880923D42B6823186F26CEE6D0B.description: Examine how an individuals’ housing needs and wants change over a lifetime

772AAF1F4BFE4D40B9925A6842452E80.description: Develop client profiles for real or imagined clients and real or imagined interior design and/or decorating projects.

000367AE3C3E46ED80C70C075C53522F.description: Compare how client profiles might differ for new house builds, co-housing, renovations or commercial projects.

BCFC42C8C5684B878CC59DC45C094023.description: Create a visual representation of physical and physiological needs and wants from a client perspective.

5DD2E483FB334F72ADE1BB02833A01C9.description: Conduct research on client’s needs, wants and preferences related to specific interior design and decorating projects.

C2FF580CE0B84CAD897B7C9C24DBE0FE.description: Examine how the client’s budget helps to prioritize their needs and wants.

C5DAEF47C8804CAFA2DCC6E4E1273CB0.description: Discuss how an individual’s physical (e.g., safety, shelter) and psychological (e.g., love, privacy, belonging, success) needs can influence their design and decorating decisions.

2B92817F4B1E4E4E9A326957AD4BBBEC.description: Discuss the type of information (e.g., family, lifestyle, style preferences, storage requirements, budget, sensory considerations) interior designers or interior decorators should seek from the client to develop a client profile

03FB332CE1B548DC8E2465C020C4353F.description: Differentiate between needs, wants and preferences.

D310691EC1FC40A29790BA4304AD882F.description: Develop client profiles based on their needs, wants and preferences.

5B04CBEEB9304B94BA11B19D41A10A57.description: Create a visual, such as a flowchart or concept map, illustrating how the design process is non-linear and iterative.

141FFB21FAE7436EB69F9F61E89A37A2.description: Outline the major stages (e.g., inspiration, ideation, implementation) of design thinking as they might apply to interior design or decorating

C9FA3395A86B41EDAEFD9A6ED0A8565A.description: Outline steps within the major phases of design processes, including: defining the problem; collecting information; brainstorming and analyzing ideas; developing solutions and building models; presenting ideas for feedback; and, improving the design.

8EEB437865584CEEAA92E0CDDF685D94.description: Examine the importance of creativity in design processes.

C6EFFAC8F79247D4A8D8EA2159DB154B.description: Analyze design processes common to interior design and decorating.

B5801F9EF5624CBEA04EF52816BD8B0C.description: Discuss how to celebrate cultural influences in interior design and decorating.

975B3A725A004C10B04227CAF6E0B1E2.description: Explain ethical cultural appreciation (e.g., buying from ethical sources, buying from the maker, avoiding misuse of sacred symbols) in interior design and decorating.

E1069131D909476FA81ECC166AE0250F.description: Differentiate between cultural appropriation and cultural appreciation.

EB691FCF257E4209A53A6550B661491D.description: Provide examples of the influences of various cultures globally on interior design and decorating choices.

D78D53D06A714B88BC1FE8540656D8C9.description: Recognize influences of First Nations, Métis and Inuit cultures on interior design and decorating choices

B85FFDE6949D4FF196687D72E622EA1D.description: Investigate how culture affects housing preferences, considering factors such as: size and structure of home; multigenerational living; religion and spirituality; cultural expression; communal space; and, private spaces.

13BAA4AD3312409FADEE0883733C4046.description: Explore how cultural and global influences impact interior design and decorating.

5172BE7EBA9E40C5BD6C6E9BFF93A462.description: Discuss how design is human-centered (e.g., focus on people, functional, aesthetic).

1D136C2BF89140369946700DFCB4F416.description: Examine the influence of culture in interior design and decorating.

868AE93231E84618BBF51973B0D9D5C9.description: Develop and apply criteria to evaluate specific designs based on the principles of design.

3F5D10F365F64E1EA6F2043E28303BC1.description: Research how to achieve harmony through a balance of unity and variety.

EB17FFC86ED948A0B772BB730F175750.description: Describe how emphasis creates focal points in a space.

99D32ED6D2624D83AA9E506AEC288360.description: Describe how different types (e.g., alternation, progression, repetition, transition) of rhythm can be used effectively in design.

6506E32EDC9A492BBDD01FD99B352FB4.description: Provide examples of the effective use of scale in different types of spaces.

1D1CADDA504849EC8E6D19F60FDEF65D.description: Research how different proportion systems (e.g., golden mean, Le Corbusier’s Modulor) can guide design

97439CC50F2249B0983783A97692C9F8.description: Provide examples of formal (e.g., symmetrical), informal (e.g., asymmetrical) and radial forms of balance in a room or accessory.

CE8D2FCB337F41F0BABA00CB12FD770E.description: Explore common principles of design including: balance; proportion;  scale; rhythm; emphasis; and, harmony

3362C9DA63DD4C1289411439C3966F22.description: Explain how interior designers and decorators apply the elements of design using the principles of design.

DB02FE1ED6DF432DBD22675C8A5F4DB7.description: Examine how interior designers and decorators incorporate principles of design to create appealing and functional spaces.

A0BF3A1D89FA48CCACBB0D263A792CC8.description: Predict how changing one or more elements of design can impact other elements in a specific space

2E1D2F0FFA504024AB280EE8DFFA03E7.description: Examine how different types of patterns (e.g., naturalistic, organic, geometric, abstract, metamorphic) can be used in design and decorating.

5637409D52F94D039E486AA60CFC0E24.description: Explain the characteristics of the six standard colour scheme harmonies: analogous; monochromatic; complementary; split complementary; triadic; and, tetrad.

5F0CED91ABEB4D109D03EF6474A79B8B.description: Differentiate among the basic attributes of colour (e.g., hue, value, intensity).

E3ED183128684D579EF04406B54699AB.description: Demonstrate how colour systems (e.g., colour wheel) show relationships between colours

7D5CC23D2FFE4FA2BA2CA0C4D9ED96D4.description: Explore how colour can be used to impact people’s moods, feelings and behaviours.

D268DEBEF41843398E565FA86A6142A2.description: Describe the role of lighting such as ambient, task, accent and natural, in design and decorating.

82C28E9959D44CB984E4186D13BC313D.description: Compare how visual and tactile textures can be applied to design and decorating.

6714B02774904DF5A4C21CBF73DA9A84.description: Explore how space can be manipulated to create specific feelings.

7D92E589C6BA45FAA81573CD80BF2567.description: Research the effect of form and how it can be used efficiently in interior design.

7DE8B84E98A744C88AA2E3EE84520499.description: Describe various effects that can be achieved by manipulating line.

072B9139BBA64DA39A1980F45C12D5BE.description: Explore the characteristics of the common elements of design including: line; form; space; texture; light; colour; and, pattern

3865B3F1E7D6461CA254C33004E48815.description: Differentiate between the elements and principles of design.

21614C28ED3F4992AAEE0A72FE15A9C9.description: Identify potential workplace health and safety hazards (e.g., excessive computer use, improper ergonomics for workspace) and methods to mitigate risk.

97412EB93DFA4CD4A8D54631DD120507.description: Discuss risk mitigation and how it can prevent injuries at work.

83755A6673174CD88322E524CE5EF4B6.description: Discuss the need for interior designers and interior decorators to recognize and apply safe and fair work practices, including freedom from violence, harassment and bullying (e.g., professional code of ethics).

B540979DEADE44508D2337AD38D7CB97.description: Research interior design and interior decorating needs for various types of spaces such as: residential; commercial (e.g., retail, office, restaurant); educational; industrial; and, spaces such as childcare centres, seniors living, healthcare and public multiuse spaces (e.g., sports complexes) with specific needs.

57300FEA86C644D499A10E88A558F832.description: Discuss how interior designers and interior decorators influence how clients think, feel and act in spaces.

28814B39FB074AAA877D0613D0FBC16E.description: Examine how interior designers and interior decorators work together and with clients.

DD29CE65698A4825ABD1C4FE0EC9F3E4.description: Discuss the client-focused nature of interior design and interior decorating

9F4F95FFFB4441299CB2183962A40EEF.description: Compare the roles of interior designers and interior decorators, how they differ from each other and how they differ from the role of architects and other related professions.

8E6DA8774789419AB030BA4543412D3D.description: Provide examples of the types of problems that interior designers solve and those that interior decorators solve.

1C63B68E23F349D991203F700DAECB6D.description: Research the qualifications of interior designers and interior decorators.

2F42075CB6B247D192C8EBE2FB58C686.description: Differentiate between interior design and interior decorating.

21BEC2E55FC84E9EB83D86BE773F2DAC.description: Research roles and responsibilities of interior designers and interior decorators.
